channel.title: Making my client available for others?
channel.description: hey how would i be able to get my client that has my ip in it, let say my friend, to my friend so that he doesnt have to do anything.

@dots wrote:

ok and then the EGUI should be perfect then right? then all i should worry about is the “CLIENT”?

item.title: Making my client available for others?
item.dc:creator: @dots dots
item.description:
@dots wrote:

YES I HAVE PORT FOWARDED[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 30, 2009, 11:10:38 pm[/size][hr]
sorry for the caps above lol and this what my EGUI pad says inside

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“moore.no-ip.biz”, “localhost”, “43594”
});
}
}
[/code]

item.title: Making my client available for others?
item.dc:creator: @h4x0r88 h4x0r88
item.description:
@h4x0r88 wrote:

lol

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 30, 2009, 05:43:14 pm[/size][hr]before i tell you, have you port forwarded
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 30, 2009, 05:47:29 pm[/size][hr][quote=“birdman4657, post:23, topic:290583”]TRY THIS

go into your client.java file

search for this

return new Socket

it should look something like this

public final Socket method19(int i)//set the ip throws IOException { if(signlink.mainapp != null) return signlink.opensocket(i); else return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(Gui.server), i);// sets ip for server when client files is used over gui }

select all of the above and change it to this

public final Socket method19(int i)//set the ip throws IOException { return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName("YOUR IP ADDRESS"), i);// sets ip for server when client files is used over gui }

change YOUR IP ADDRESS to your ip address… lol i hope this helps[/quote] i think you should give credits to the one who realy wrote that tut

Read full topic

it should look something like this

public final Socket method19(int i)//set the ip throws IOException { if(signlink.mainapp != null) return signlink.opensocket(i); else return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName(Gui.server), i);// sets ip for server when client files is used over gui }

public final Socket method19(int i)//set the ip throws IOException { return new Socket(InetAddress.getByName("YOUR IP ADDRESS"), i);// sets ip for server when client files is used over gui }

have you portforward before you have to so people can come on i did it and worked fine if you need help its very easy ok, first step how to find your defulat gateway ip. if you have vista open start and type “command prompt” then type in there ipconfig, once got open a new tab type it in dont inclued the www. just type it in then it says to log in U MUST TYPE ADMIN AS USERBAME AND PASS IS PASSWORD

once you get that far send me a message

item.title: Making my client available for others?
item.dc:creator: @dots dots
item.description:
@dots wrote:

[quote=“©opyright, post:4, topic:290583”]I will, but this should be in the client help section.

Open your client class.
Search for:

setserver

You should see:

setserver("somethinghere", "43594");

Replace somethinghere with your no-ip.

Now search for

server =

you should see:

server = "something here";

Replace something here with your no-ip.

Now open your EGUI class.

It should look something like this:

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“something here”, “localhost”, “43594”
});
}
}
[/code]

Replace something here with your no-ip.[/quote] i did all that but when i go to uppit it wont let me upload the whole folder i would have to do it in pieces

Read full topic
